pull_request.title: Resolve some McEliece AVX build issues
pull_request.body:
The first commit makes it possible to do an OQS_MINIMAL_BUILD with just the avx McEliece code. The minimal build feature uses an allowlist for platform specific symbol suffixes, the commit just adds "_avx" to that list.

The second commit is an attempt to resolve #930. Declaring the constants with ".hidden" keeps them out of the global offset table and is an alternative to using "-Wl,-Bsymbolic". CI passing here will not indicate whether this resolves #930, but this solution is preferable to Bsymbolic in any case.

The third commit replaces casts to __m256i_u* with casts to __m256i*. The __m256i_u type is a gcc extension, and was preventing us from building the McEliece avx code with clang <9.

The fourth commit is just a nit-pick.

pull_request.title: Fix OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic for Frodo
pull_request.body:
The Frodo code currently ignores OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD if it is compiled on a machine without AVX2 instructions.

https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/5b2ed97f08ba94c59ea2769b5e52760accc51f44/src/kem/frodokem/external/frodo_macrify_optimized.c#L27-L40

My understanding of OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD is that a less powerful machine should be able to compile a library that takes advantage of the features of a more powerful machine (without fixing the target machine at compile time). This PR brings the Frodo code in line with my expectations.

There are other places where the OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic could be improved. E.g we ignore OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD in alg_support.cmake while setting the value of the "OQS_ENABLE_X" variables. I'll open separate issues or PRs for those.

pull_request.title: guard Frodo AVX2 code if CPU_EXTENSIONS not requested
pull_request.body:
#927 breaks builds when [OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Customizing-liboqs#oqs_use_cpu_extensions). This PR is one way to fix it. Another alternative is to not set `OQS_PORTABLE_X86_64_BUILD` if `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF`: Any preference, @jschanck ?

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

pull_request.title: interop server test script added [skip ci]
pull_request.body:
Without parameters, this script executes tests against all algorithms exposed at https://test.openquantumsafe.org outputting all KEM algorithms tested. On error, testing stops.

With any parameter, this script executes tests against all algorithms exposed at https://test.openquantumsafe.org only outputting the SIG algorithms tested. On error, testing continues, outputting test command and error.

pull_request.title: Fix OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic for upstream imports
pull_request.body:
The first commit fixes the issue that @baentsch ran into in #939.

The second commit fixes the OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic for the schemes that are imported using copy_from_upstream. Previously you would only get functional runtime CPU feature detection if you compiled on a machine with every CPU feature.

The third commit is a temporary fix so that the AVX2 implementation of HQC will compile. Turns out we've never built it! Upstream META.yml wants a 'pclmulqdq' feature, but we call that feature 'pclmul'. The new OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD logic tries to build anyway and hits some compiler warnings. I'll open issues upstream.

pull_request.title: Make OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS imply OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD=OFF; alternative…
pull_request.body:
#941 fixes the broken `OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD=ON` + `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF` combination (#939) as part of a larger effort to fix OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD. Unfortunately that's now waiting on new sha3 to merge.

@baentsch, in #939, writes:
> What I've been looking for in this case was a portable image without the need for/cost of CPU feature checks. And that --I thought-- `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF` should yield.

Here it sounds like you actually do want  `OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD=OFF` + `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF`.

That doesn't change the fact that we should have a short-term mitigation for the broken configuration. I'm fine with forcing OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD=OFF when OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS=OFF. This PR does that.
